A very busy square (traffic wise), with its centre piece, Fontaine Du Chatelet, a stunning, monumental fountain, which was erected in the early 1800's to supply the area with water, and commemorate napoleons victories. the square surround by landmarks, the theatre Chatelet and Saint Jaques Tower, both attractions in there own right.

Place du Châtelet is a public square near Pont au Change on the Right Bank side of the Seine River. The most interesting thing to see here is the Fontaine du Palmier which was designed in 1806 by François-Jean Bralle.  What you see here is a fountain basin with an 18 metre tall decorative column, topped by a gilded figure of the goddess Victory. The base of the column is surrounded by four allegorical figures. It stands upon a wider plinth with four sphinx figures, each with spouts spilled into the basin below.  It is an attractive fountain monument that is worth spending a few minutes to enjoy if you plan to pass through this area of the Right Bank. Give it a quick look-see before carrying on with other intended sightseeing.
The victory ceremony. Beautiful place to visit
Another Napoleon victory statue at the start of port au change.  No water in the fountain when we visited, perhaps it would be much more exciting with it.

The goddess statue at the top of the column seems to go well together, but the sphinx sculpture is awkwardly located at the bottom of the fountain, so it doesn't seem to resonate well.

Place du Châtelet is a historic square located in the heart of Paris, France. Here are some things to know and do when visiting this area:  1. Historical significance: Place du Châtelet has a rich history and has been an important square in Paris since ancient times. It was named after the Grand Châtelet, a medieval fortress that once stood on the site. The square was a major crossroads and played a role in the city's defense.  2. Central location: Situated at the convergence of several major roads, Place du Châtelet is a hub of activity and a convenient starting point for exploring nearby attractions. It is located between the 1st and 4th arrondissements, close to the Île de la Cité and the Seine River.  3. Theatres and entertainment: Place du Châtelet is known for its vibrant cultural scene. It is home to two famous theatres: Théâtre du Châtelet and Théâtre de la Ville. These venues host a variety of performances, including musicals, opera, dance, and concerts. Check their schedules for upcoming shows.  4. Fountain and statues: The square features a large fountain called the Fontaine du Palmier. It was built in the early 19th century and is adorned with statues and reliefs depicting historical figures and events. Take a moment to admire the fountain and its intricate details.  5. Shopping and dining: Place du Châtelet is surrounded by shops, cafes, and restaurants, making it a great place to take a break and enjoy some local cuisine. Explore the streets radiating from the square to discover a variety of dining options, from casual cafes to fine dining establishments.  6. Proximity to other attractions: From Place du Châtelet, you can easily reach other popular landmarks on foot or by public transportation. The Notre-Dame Cathedral, the Louvre Museum, and the Pompidou Center are all within walking distance. You can also catch a boat tour on the Seine River nearby.  7. Nightlife: Place du Châtelet comes alive at night with its lively atmosphere and numerous bars and clubs. If you're looking for some nightlife options, this area offers a range of venues to suit different tastes.  When visiting Place du Châtelet, take the time to appreciate its historical significance, enjoy the cultural offerings, and explore the surrounding attractions.

Place du Chatelet is where the Tourist info office is...  It also has a Fountain du Palmier [216 years old] in its centre and can be easily reached at the metro station and train hub "Chatelet les Halles" [which is also the largest underground subway/train station in the World].  Les Halles is the site of the original "farmers market" and now hosts a very "mixed bag" of interesting shoppes.  A trip to Paris is incomplete without a visit to this interesting,  historic/busy area!!  I hope that this Review has been helpful!!
